Much of what Paul Joseph Watson does has real-world consequences that cannot be laughed off.  In 2016, his propagation of the rumor that Hillary Clinton had serious health conditions with absolutely no evidence gained enough traction that it started becoming a national story.  In 2017, as one of the early incarnations of his popular This City is a Shithole series, which looks to demonstrate how once great empires are stained with the blight of immigrants spraying feces on the walls, Paul hired far-left revered journalist Tim Poole to travel to Sweden in order to expose the crime-ridden migrant suburbs of Malmo.

Paul Joseph Watson of Infowars put out a call saying, I challenge any journalist to spend a weekend in Malmo and I'll cover your costs.  For years, on my Wikipedia page, it claimed that I invented a zeppelin.

The vast majority of his series on shithole cities had been demonstrated to be a combination of xenophobia, beer-mongering, and outright lies and manipulation.  Speaking of outright lies and manipulation, in a White House press briefing in 2018, the questioning of President Donald Trump by CNN's Jim Acosta led to his press credentials being revoked.  This was justified by claiming that Acosta had accosted an intern by placing his hands on her while she attempted to rip the microphone from him amid questioning.  Watson uploaded a version of the incident in which the zoom and frame rate were doctored to support the claims made by the administration.  Then White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders used Watson's video as evidence spreading the misrepresentation that Jim Acosta had acted inappropriately despite original footage of the incident being widely available everywhere.  This became a widely publicized incident in which the White House deliberately spread fake news to justify their own narrative.
